body.name: Ripe
body.description: 2023 San Francisco Book Festival WINNER - Science FictionEveryone remembers exactly where they were, the day the ships came.What no one knew back then, though, was that there were people who were already expecting them.Scottish psychologist Elspeth McGann thinks her patient Lester Rains-a suave, enigmatic man who claims to be have been alive for 2,000 years and to be part of a team of extraterrestrial 'farmers' waiting on Earth for an alien harvest-is a delusional schizophrenic. But when vast ships suddenly appear over Moscow and vacuum up 50,000 people in a matter of hours, she realizes she must track down the elusive Rains. In her search, she stumbles upon a group who are already trying to track down the farmers. This band of renegades is led by Cassius C. Trenton, a former NSA analyst who has been on the run since he broke the code on a mystery transmission beamed into space from Earth years ago, and which bore a single, chilling message: Ripe.With the aliens set to return, and some world leaders complicit in their plans, Elspeth and Trenton must seek out Rains and find a way of escaping the impending apocalypse, a hunt that takes them from Edinburgh to the White House, only to discover the harvest is just the beginning. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Alien invasion or not
reviews.reviewText: Amazing alien “invasion”, actual manipulation of humans to evolve using alien dna since early man. Wild story in a great way! Will there be more adventures to come?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: There are some skips and plot gaps that may confuse the inattentive reader, but all in all, , this is a unique approach to the old theme of alien invasion m. I enjoyed the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: First off, great book, but ending sucked. I assumed I was reading a stand alone book, my bad. So I expected the author to thank the reader and tel them to stay tuned for next book…..but alas no.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Page Turner
reviews.reviewText: A thrilling Page Turning Novel. A different take on a First Contact Novel. Highly Recommended. Not a Dud, Not filled with Nagging Inconsistencies. I’m very glad a took a chance on this in spite of a few naysayers in the reviews.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Almost dead but still a story to tell
reviews.reviewText: A good book that lagged a bit in the 3rd quarter … but it came back to finish strong!I liked it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Good Read
reviews.reviewText: A fascinating story with good character development. I’ll probably read it again this year. Instructions says I need six more words.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This story got to me.
reviews.reviewText: I thought it a little corny initially, then quaint and finally compelling. I liked the character development and the plot. There was a surreal quality throughout that was compelling. I really found this an enjoyable read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Does not end well
reviews.reviewText: Argh! I finished this book in a day-- so it was interesting reading, for the most part. The author spent lots of time developing his characters and the world of the story only to finish rather abruptly with a non-satisfying ending. Seriously, the book ended with "The End." A few sentences above and you were in a very active scene. Disappointing.

I truly enjoy this book from beginning to end. An original story, well written and a great pace from beginning to end. It's also so refreshing that this is not another one that ends up becoming the first in a series, but back to the good old format of writing complete and stand stories. The characters are well developed and easy to get attached to. I'm looking forward to reading more from this author, but hopefully a new and equally creative story, not an never ending milking of the same as many do. Well done!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Just finished this page turner. Bleak, brutal and bizarre. Hider creates an uncomfortable read - drawn I assume from his observations of the depths of humanity’s inhumanity and the poor treatment of the world we in habit. The book left me with a deep sense of apocalyptic foreboding that can only be read in the ‘now’ world of forest fires, flash floods and a rapidly cooking earth. Together with this context, Ripe stokes a disquieting atavistic dread which will sit with me for some time. The storyline starts ordinary/everyday and then builds into something fantastical -a catherine wheel of aliens, AI, Glocks and feeding tubes. Hold on to your hats!I won’t be visiting my local ‘Harvester’ restaurant or thinking about Farmers in the same way again.
I liked the style and I liked the main character.
Great characters in outrageous situations. Lots of action and surprises to keep the pages turning. Cool take on alien invasion. Writing always smooth and easy, like a lot of classic SF authors.
Most excellent .. but the only important question really remaining is - when’s the sequel? Hopefully soon soon soon ❤️
